title: Introducing: Nathan Sharpe
content: Continuing on from the fantastic Jamie Isaac whom we brought to you last week, we’ve got another UK musician set to grace the pages of CitR for the first time. This debut track from Bristol producer Nathan Sharpe, is an intricately beautiful acoustic number, fusing ambient influences and a stellar knowledge of ‘glo-fi’ songwriting. The backing samples and dubstep reminiscent percussion sections really elevate Escape No Romance beyond being just ‘another acoustic track’, and transform it into a rather magnificent piece of work. The vocals are expertly timed and melancholic in tone, whilst the lyrics echo the delivery in their despondent tone; ‘Is this all we’ll ever see? Is this all we’ll ever be?’ laments Sharpe morosely. Don’t let that put you off though, Escape No Romance is a transcendentally moving piece and coupled with Isaac’s stunning Intro/Drowning Roots, is hopefully a sign of the direction the UK music scene is progressing.
